facts.text: Traditional date for the foundation of Japan by Emperor Jimmu
Tiberius Claudius Caesar Britannicus, heir to the Roman Emperorship, dies under mysterious circumstances in Rome. This clears the way for Nero to become Emperor.
Siricius, bishop of Tarragona, elected as Bishop of Rome; first to style himself Pope.
St Paschal I ends his reign as Pope
Elizabeth of York, Queen Consort of England, dies at 37
Henry VIII recognised as supreme head of Church in England following the schism with Rome
Battle at Wayna Daga: Ethiopian/Portugese troops beat Muslim army
King Frederick of Denmark offers island of Hveen to Tycho Brahe
The assault on Copenhagen by Swedish forces is beaten back with heavy losses.
Sweden & Prussia sign peace (2nd Treaty of Stockholm)
Stamp Act declared unconstitutional in Virginia
Samuel Adams letter, circulates around American colonies, opposing Townshend Act taxes
